job_title: Entry Level Technical Support Engineer - Austin, Lowell, San Jose,Durham
job_description: software engineering job for the role Entry Level Technical Support Engineer - Austin, Lowell, San Jose,Durham

• Experience working with lab data, test results, or engineering datasets through coursework or projects.
• Strong analytical, problem‑solving, and communication skills.
• Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s program in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a closely related technical field.
• Explore AI‑enabled or data‑driven approaches to enhance engineering workflows and data usability.
• Ability to work effectively both independently and within a team environment.
• Familiarity with Linux environments or engineering development workflows.

• Bachelor's degree in Engineering or a Business-related or quantitative field (Finance, Economics, or similar subject area), and 2 years of experience in a combination of capacity planning, business analyst and / or process analyst roles Experience analyzing and interpreting data, drawing conclusions, defining recommended actions, and reporting results across diverse technical and non-technical groups Experience turning sophisticated and ambiguous problem statements into structured solutions while working in a highly multi-functional environment Master's degree in Engineering or a Business-related or quantitative field (Finance, Economics, or similar subject area) 1- 3 years of experience in crafting and developing web-based reporting metrics (e.
• Tableau, Python) Experience working in teams, establishing and maintaining multi-functional and working relationships Experience operating independently while maintaining a high degree of organization and control Less than 2 years Design, track, and communicate capital change proposals to manufacturing senior leaders through reporting tools (e.
• Tableau) and formal presentation Lead and communicate improvement opportunities and implementation plans to all relevant levels and functions in manufacturing.

• Your role will involve collaborating with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and implement software applications that meet the needs of our customers.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements.
• In this role, you will play a key part in defining software requirements, designing embedded solutions, and verifying system performance, ensuring our maintenance systems meet the evolving needs of modern aircraft.
• The ideal candidate will bring hands‑on experience with system‑level testing, REST APIs, structured data formats, and embedded or IoT platforms to ensure the reliability, performance, and compliance of technologies deployed across mission‑critical environments worldwide.
• You’ll bridge engineering and IT to ensure complex aerospace development ecosystems perform at scale, meet rigorous standards, and align with regulatory and export‑controlled requirements.
• This position is ideal for engineers experienced in modern software development methodologies, debugging, and performance optimization, who thrive in highly technical, cross‑functional environments.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements You will report directly to our Senior Engineering Manager and you will work out of our Phoenix, AZ location on a Hybrid work schedule.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements.
